intro: Buchnera prorepens, commonly known as the small-flowered bugleweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Buchnera prorepens is known for its ability to attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
